intro: Onychium carvifolium, commonly known as the serrated onychium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
